Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a removal order be stayed based on an outstanding H&C application and the best interests of Canadian children?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed her visa, refugee claim denied, filed H&C application four months before removal.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Enforcement Officer acted within legal limits
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant with pending H&C application
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Overstayed visa, failed to leave after refugee claim denial
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Pending H&C application and best interests of Canadian children
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Removal must occur as soon as reasonably practicable unless statutory exceptions apply
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timeliness of H&C application, medical issues, best interests of children
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether enforcement officer erred in refusing deferral
Crimes.Evidence_Used: H&C application, medical reports, family circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: H&C application submitted four months prior to removal
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal pending H&C assessment
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 48 mandates timely execution of removal orders
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought to defer deportation citing H&C application and children's best interests
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: H&C application considered but not sufficient for deferral
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - Overstay provisions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of concrete evidence of irreparable harm
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Pending H&C application does not automatically stay removal
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Enforcement officer followed statutory mandate; no error in law
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration Enforcement Officer, reviewed by court
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to enforcement discretion

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's deportation be stayed based on her H&C application and the best interests of her Canadian children?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant failed to attend interviews, filed H&C application late, lacked evidence of harm
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No serious issue or irreparable harm proven
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant with delayed H&C filing
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to comply with reporting requirements and removal process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Best interests of Canadian children and pending H&C application
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Removal must proceed unless specific statutory stays apply
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timeliness of application, credibility, uniqueness of hardship
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether enforcement officer erred in not deferring removal
Crimes.Evidence_Used: H&C application, family ties, lack of attendance records
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Late H&C filing, insufficient proof of exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal pending H&C review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Removal orders executed promptly absent statutory exceptions
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of concrete evidence of irreparable harm
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Harm claims deemed speculative and unproven
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought delay in deportation due to H&C application and child welfare concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Claims evaluated but found insufficient for relief
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient documentation to support hardship claims
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant with immigration status and removal directives
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No compelling evidence of unique or severe hardship
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious issue raised; irreparable harm not established
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration Enforcement Officer, subject to judicial review
